010package imagingbook.common.color.quantize;
011
012
013import java.util.AbstractSet;
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.Comparator;
016import java.util.HashSet;
017import java.util.Set;
018
019import ij.IJ;
020import ij.ImagePlus;
021import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
022import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
023import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
024import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
025import imagingbook.common.color.statistics.ColorHistogram;
026
027/**
028 * This is an implementation of Heckbert's median-cut color quantization algorithm 
029 * (Heckbert P., "Color Image Quantization for Frame Buffer Display", ACM Transactions
030 * on Computer Graphics (SIGGRAPH), pp. 297-307, 1982).
031 * Unlike in the original algorithm, no initial uniform (scalar) quantization is used to
032 * for reducing the number of image colors. Instead, all colors contained in the original
033 * image are considered in the quantization process. After the set of representative
034 * colors has been found, each image color is mapped to the closest representative
035 * in RGB color space using the Euclidean distance.
036 * The quantization process has two steps: first a ColorQuantizer object is created from
037 * a given image using one of the constructor methods provided. Then this ColorQuantizer
038 * can be used to quantize the original image or any other image using the same set of 
039 * representative colors (color table).
040 * 
041 * @author WB
042 * @version 2017/01/03
043 * 
044 * TODO: needs revision!
045 */
046public class MedianCutQuantizer implements ColorQuantizer {
047        
048        private final ColorNode[] allColors;    // a vector of color nodes (used by inner classes)
049        private final Set<ColorBox> quantColors;
050//      private final ColorNode root;           TODO: organize color boxes in a tree
051        
052        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
053        
054        public MedianCutQuantizer(ColorProcessor ip, int K) {
055                this((int[]) ip.getPixels(), K);
056        }
057                 
058        public MedianCutQuantizer(int[] pixels, int K) {
059                allColors = getAllColors(pixels);
060                if (allColors.length <= K) {            // not enough colors, nothing to quantize
061                        quantColors = null;
062                        return;
063                }
064                else {
065                        quantColors = findReferenceColors(K);
066                }
067        }
068        
069        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
070        
071//      void listColors(ColorNode[] colors) {
072//              for (ColorNode nd : colors) {
073//                      IJ.log(nd.toString());
074//              }
075//      }
076        
077        private ColorNode[] getAllColors(int[] pixels) {
078                ColorHistogram colorHist = new ColorHistogram(pixels);
079                final int nc = colorHist.getNumberOfColors();
080                ColorNode[] colors = new ColorNode[nc];
081                for (int i = 0; i < nc; i++) {
082                        int rgb = colorHist.getColor(i);
083                        int cnt = colorHist.getCount(i);
084                        colors[i] = new ColorNode(rgb, cnt);
085                }
086                return colors;
087        }
088
089        private Set<ColorBox> findReferenceColors(int K) {
090                final int n = allColors.length;
091
092                ColorBox cb0 = new ColorBox(0, n - 1, 0);
093                AbstractSet<ColorBox> B = new HashSet<ColorBox>();
094                B.add(cb0);
095                
096                int k = 1;                                              // number of quantized color (color boxes)
097                boolean done = false;
098                
099                while (k < K && !done) {
100                        ColorBox cb = findBoxToSplit(B);
101                        if (cb != null) {
102                                ColorBox[] boxes = cb.splitBox();
103                                B.remove(cb);
104                                B.add(boxes[0]);
105                                B.add(boxes[1]);
106                                k = k + 1;
107                        } else {
108                                done = true;
109                        }
110                }
111                return B;
112
113        }
114        
115        private float[][] makeColorMap(Set<ColorBox> quantColors) {
116                int n = quantColors.size();
117                float[][] map = new float[n][];
118                int i = 0;
119                for (ColorBox cb : quantColors) {
120                        map[i] = cb.getAvgColor();
121                        i++;
122                }
123                return map;
124        }
125        
126        private ColorBox findBoxToSplit(Iterable<ColorBox> colorBoxes) {
127                // from the set of splitable color boxes
128                // select the one with the minimum level
129                ColorBox boxToSplit = null;
130                int minLevel = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
131                for (ColorBox cb : colorBoxes) {
132                        if (cb.colorCount() >= 2) {     // box can be split
133                                if (cb.level < minLevel) {
134                                        boxToSplit = cb;
135                                        minLevel = cb.level;
136                                }
137                        }
138                }
139                return boxToSplit;
140        }
141        
142//      private ColorNode[] getAvgColors(Iterable<ColorBox> colorBoxes) {
143//              //int n = colorBoxes.size();
144////            ColorNode[] avgColors = new ColorNode[colorBoxes.size()];
145//              List<ColorNode> avgColors = new ArrayList<>();
146//              int i = 0;
147//              for (ColorBox box : colorBoxes) {
148//                      //avgColors[i] = box.getAvgColor();
149//                      avgColors.add(box.getAvgColor());
150//                      i = i + 1;
151//              }
152////            return avgColors;
153//              return avgColors.toArray(new ColorNode[0]);
154//      }
155        
156        
157        // ------- methods required by abstract super class -----------------------
158        
159        @Override
160        public float[][] getColorMap() {
161                return makeColorMap(quantColors);
162        }
163
164        // -------------- class ColorNode -------------------------------------------
165
166        private class ColorNode {
167                private final int red, grn, blu;
168                private final int cnt;
169                
170                ColorNode (int rgb, int cnt) {
171                        //this.rgb = (rgb & 0xFFFFFF);
172                        int[] c = RgbUtils.intToRgb(rgb);
173                        this.red = c[0];
174                        this.grn = c[1];
175                        this.blu = c[2];
176                        this.cnt = cnt;
177                }
178                
179                @SuppressWarnings("unused")
180                ColorNode (int red, int grn, int blu, int cnt) {
181                        //this.rgb = Rgb.rgbToInt(red, grn, blu);
182                        this.red = red;
183                        this.grn = grn;
184                        this.blu = blu;
185                        this.cnt = cnt;
186                }
187                
188                public String toString() {
189                        String s = ColorNode.class.getSimpleName();
190                        s = s + " red=" + red + " green=" + grn + " blue=" + blu + " count=" + cnt;
191                        return s;
192                }
193        }
194        
195        // -------------- non-static inner class ColorBox -----------------------------------
196
197        /**
198         * Represents a 'color box' holding a set of colors (of type {@link ColorNode}),
199         * which is implemented as a contiguous range of elements in array
200         * {@link MedianCutQuantizer#allColors}. Instances of {@link ColorBox} reference
201         * this array directly (this is why this class is non-static).
202         */
203        private class ColorBox { 
204                final int lower;                // lower index into 'imageColors'
205                final int upper;                // upper index into 'imageColors'
206                final int level;                // split level of this color box
207                
208                int count = 0;  // number of pixels represented by this color box
209                float rmin, rmax;       // range of contained colors in red dimension
210                float gmin, gmax;       // range of contained colors in green dimension
211                float bmin, bmax;       // range of contained colors in blue dimension
212                
213                ColorBox(int lower, int upper, int level) {
214                        this.lower = lower;
215                        this.upper = upper;
216                        this.level = level;
217                        this.trim();
218                }
219                
220                /**
221                 * Returns the number of different colors within this color box.
222                 * @return the number of different colors
223                 */
224                int colorCount() {
225                        return upper - lower;
226                }
227                
228                /**
229                 * Recalculates the boundaries and population of this color box.
230                 */
231                private void trim() {
232                        int n = 0;      
233                        rmin = gmin = bmin = MAX_RGB;
234                        rmax = gmax = bmax = 0;
235                        for (int i = lower; i <= upper; i++) {
236                                ColorNode color = allColors[i];
237                                n = n + color.cnt;
238                                rmax = Math.max(color.red, rmax);
239                                rmin = Math.min(color.red, rmin);
240                                gmax = Math.max(color.grn, gmax);
241                                gmin = Math.min(color.grn, gmin);
242                                bmax = Math.max(color.blu, bmax);
243                                bmin = Math.min(color.blu, bmin);
244                        }
245                        count = n;
246                }
247                
248                /**
249                 * Splits this color box at the median point along its 
250                 * longest color dimension. Modifies the original color
251                 * box and creates a new one, which is returned.
252                 * @return A new box.
253                 */
254                ColorBox[] splitBox() { 
255                        if (this.colorCount() < 2)      // this box cannot be split
256                                return null;
257                        else {
258                                int m = this.level;
259                                // find longest dimension of this box:
260                                ColorDimension d = this.getMaxBoxDimension();
261                                // find median along dimension d
262                                int med = this.findMedian(d);
263                                // now split this box at the median return the resulting new box
264                                ColorBox b1 = new ColorBox(lower, med, m + 1);
265                                ColorBox b2 = new ColorBox(med + 1, upper, m + 1);
266                                return new ColorBox[] {b1, b2};
267                        }
268                }
269                
270                /**
271                 * Finds the longest dimension of this color box (RED, GREEN, or BLUE)
272                 * @return The color dimension of the longest box side.
273                 */
274                ColorDimension getMaxBoxDimension() {
275                        final float rLength = rmax - rmin;
276                        final float gLength = gmax - gmin;
277                        final float bLength = bmax - bmin;
278                        if (bLength >= rLength && bLength >= gLength)
279                                return ColorDimension.BLU;
280                        else if (gLength >= rLength && gLength >= bLength)
281                                return ColorDimension.GRN;
282                        else 
283                                return ColorDimension.RED;
284                }
285                                
286                /**
287                 * Finds the position of the median of this color box in RGB space along
288                 * the red, green or blue dimension, respectively.
289                 * @param dim Color dimension.
290                 * @return The median value.
291                 */
292                int findMedian(ColorDimension dim) {
293                        // sort color in this box along dimension dim:
294                        Arrays.sort(allColors, lower, upper + 1, dim.comparator);
295                        // find the median point:
296                        int half = count / 2;
297                        int k, pixCnt;
298                        for (k = lower, pixCnt = 0; k < upper; k++) {
299                                pixCnt = pixCnt + allColors[k].cnt;
300                                if (pixCnt >= half)
301                                        break;
302                        }                       
303                        return k;               // k = index of median
304                }
305                
306                /**
307                 * Calculates the (linear) average of the colors contained in this color box
308                 * and returns the result as a {@link ColorNode} instance.
309                 * The components are not rounded to integers (this is why they are of type float
310                 * in the first place).
311                 * 
312                 * @return the average color in this box
313                 */
314                float[] getAvgColor() {
315                        double rSum = 0;
316                        double gSum = 0;
317                        double bSum = 0;
318                        int n = 0;
319                        for (int i = lower; i <= upper; i++) {
320                                ColorNode cn = allColors[i];
321                                int cnt = cn.cnt;
322                                rSum = rSum + cnt * cn.red;
323                                gSum = gSum + cnt * cn.grn;
324                                bSum = bSum + cnt * cn.blu;
325                                n = n + cnt;
326                        }
327                        float avgRed = (float) (rSum / n);
328                        float avgGrn = (float) (gSum / n);
329                        float avgBlu = (float) (bSum / n);
330                        return new float[] {avgRed, avgGrn, avgBlu};
331                }
332
333                @Override
334                public String toString() {
335                        String s = this.getClass().getSimpleName();
336                        s = s + " lower=" + lower + " upper=" + upper;
337                        s = s + " count=" + count + " level=" + level;
338                        s = s + " rmin=" + rmin + " rmax=" + rmax;
339                        s = s + " gmin=" + gmin + " gmax=" + gmax;
340                        s = s + " bmin=" + bmin + " bmax=" + bmax;
341                        s = s + " bmin=" + bmin + " bmax=" + bmax;
342                        return s;
343                }
344        }
345                
346        /**
347         * The main purpose of this inner enumeration class is to associate the
348         * color dimensions RED, GRN, BLU with the corresponding comparators
349         * (for sorting along selected color dimensions).
350         */
351        private enum ColorDimension {
352                RED (new Comparator<ColorNode>() {
353                        @Override
354                        public int compare(ColorNode colA, ColorNode colB) {
355                                return Float.compare(colA.red, colB.red);
356                        }}), 
357                GRN (new Comparator<ColorNode>() {
358                        @Override
359                        public int compare(ColorNode colA, ColorNode colB) {
360                                return Float.compare(colA.grn, colB.grn);
361                        }}), 
362                BLU (new Comparator<ColorNode>() {
363                        @Override
364                        public int compare(ColorNode colA, ColorNode colB) {
365                                return Float.compare(colA.blu, colB.blu);
366                        }});
367
368                final Comparator<ColorNode> comparator;
369
370                // constructor:
371                ColorDimension(Comparator<ColorNode> cmp) {
372                        this.comparator = cmp;
373                }
374        }
375        
376        
377        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
378        
379        public static void main(String[] args) {
380//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/alps-01s.png";
381                String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/desaturation-hsv/balls.jpg";
382//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/single-color.png";
383//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/two-colors.png";
384//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/random-colors.png";
385//              String path = "D:/svn-book/Book/img/ch-color-images/ramp-fire.png";
386                
387                int K = 16; 
388                System.out.println("image = " + path);
389                System.out.println("K = " + K);
390
391                ImagePlus im = IJ.openImage(path);
392                if (im == null) {
393                        System.out.println("could not open: " + path);
394                        return;
395                }
396                
397                ImageProcessor ip = im.getProcessor();
398                ColorProcessor cp = ip.convertToColorProcessor();
399                
400                MedianCutQuantizer quantizer = new MedianCutQuantizer(cp, K);
401                quantizer.listColorMap();
402                
403                System.out.println("quantizing image");
404                ByteProcessor qi = quantizer.quantize(cp);
405                System.out.println("showing image");
406                (new ImagePlus("quantizez", qi)).show();
407                
408        }
409        
410}
